medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset of vertigo and left tinnitus with concomitant acute left hearing loss.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first experienced an acute episode of vertigo and left tinnitus three years prior to evaluation. Symptoms were attributed to Ménière disease and a low-sodium diet was prescribed without relief. Two years later, she had an episode of sudden left hearing loss coinciding with an exacerbation of vertigo and left tinnitus. The most recent episode occurred just before her evaluation at NIH, confirming left intralabyrinthine hemorrhage and a small endolymphatic sac tumor.
medical_history.family_history: Mother diagnosed with von Hippel-Lindau disease after finding bilateral renal cell carcinomas and pancreatic cysts.
